page.title: 09WENTBRIDGE TODAY -WENT HILLS
page.content: Wentbridge lies alongside the old A1. Apart from a small development of expensive modern houses on the eastern side of the road, most of the houses are close to the roadside and many of them are quite old. Most of the houses are built from limestone, which was quarried locally. Some of the houses have stone flags instead of tiles on the roof. Some of the houses have Preservation Orders on them. Some are houses converted from the old coaching inns. There is only one shop in Wentbridge. This is the Post Office and General Stores. The shop is used by some of the older inhabitants of the village, but most of the trade is casual, people buying single items as they pass through, to or from the A1. The petrol station belongs to the Post Office. This may be expanded.
